citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility has documentation of previous attending veterinarian visits through 2022, however a written Program of
Veterinary Care could not be located during inspection. A written program of veterinary care helps ensure that a licensed
facility has veterinary care available for its animals. Correction: Ensure to find the Written Program of Veterinary Care or
work with the attending veterinarian to have it re-written and approved so that it can by reviewed by APHIS official(s) in
the next re-license inspection.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections by March 6, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility has documentation of previous attending veterinarian visits through 2022, however a written Program of 
Veterinary Care could not be located during inspection.  A written program of veterinary care helps ensure that a licensed 
facility has veterinary care available for its animals.  Correction: Ensure to find the Written Program of Veterinary Care or 
work with the attending veterinarian to have it re-written and approved so that it can by reviewed by APHIS official(s) in 
the next re-license inspection. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections by  March 6, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n
